Topic.Title: Does the worst yoy pc sales drop in recorded history mean dell is worth anything less?

Message.Msg: tuttle, On the Brocade board you have been wrong for years. Nobody cares about your thoughts on stock price valuations. You have proved over and over again that you do not know anything about stock price valuations.

Topic.Title: So what if we have pc sales falling off a cliff?

Message.Msg: I suspect there is something else behind their motives to purchase and u can bet ur butt they will make money on it, whatever it is.

Topic.Title: Who do you like? Dell/Silverlake, Blackstone or Carl?

Message.Msg: NoOne Take Dell's offer or see you at 8

Ican has 2 dozen irons in the fire, this is just a sideshow for him. Why he got involved in the first place is anyone's guess. If Dell was highly sought after other companies would be topping Dell's bid.

Message.Title: DELL pumpers gone
Message.Msg: Not long ago this board suffered from posts by guys like fluteman and CTG. Shameless pumpers who bought their DELL shares too late, then cried here when they lost money as DELL share price stalled. This board was littered with fools claiming DEll was "worth $15 or even $20 plus per share". These same yahoos proclaimed "I am not selling my shares for less then $18" or "don't let Michael Dell steal your shares". Now, as expected, the hype has died down, the amateurs posting here have taken their losses and moved on, and the reasonable investor recognizes that the current $13.65 is a very generous, premium price offer. Hope this helps.
Still here...haven't changed my mind. Douche.

Message.Title: Blackstone walking away
Message.Msg: Who is left really to hold the bag?

Message.Title: DELL
Message.Msg: MS8 crushed sales of PCs and laptops hopefully MS will put the Start button back into the OS in 8.1

Lenders unwilling to finance too high of a purchase price for DELL. Dell's core busines lines are rapidly deriorating, so the value of Dell's assets is at best, a cloudy picture. When Mike Dell and silverlake initially formulated their buyout proposal, $11 per share was the price. However, strong stock market momentum, as well as advice from consultants, caused Mike Dell/Silverlake to increase their proposed offer price to the extremely high valuation of $13.65 per share. Hope this helps.

Message.Title: Half Price!!!
Message.Msg: No one ever said Michael was stupid. Dell has traded around $26. forever, now, market lull, Mike buys partners out, 100% profit. You can't make this up!
dogwood you are full of dogdoo.
